definitions: To bring down (one's foot) heavily and noisily.
To impress a pattern or mark on (a surface, object, etc.) with an engraved or inked block or die.
To affix a postage stamp to (a letter or parcel).
To characterize or mark as if with a stamp.
examples: He stamps his foot in frustration.
The machine stamps the date on each document.
She stamps the letters before mailing them.
His work stamps him as a true professional.
